promises of God.verse: "For I know the plans I have for you," declares the Lord, "plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future."
promises of God.explanation: This verse assures us that God has good plans for our lives and that He intends to bless us and give us hope for the future.

promises of God.verse: "The Lord is my rock, my fortress and my deliverer; my God is my rock, in whom I take refuge, my shield and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold."
promises of God.explanation: This verse reminds us that God is our protector and defender. When we take refuge in Him, He shields us from harm and delivers us from danger.

promises of God.verse: "Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you."
promises of God.explanation: This verse encourages us to give our worries and fears to God, knowing that He cares for us and will provide for our needs.

promises of God.verse: "So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with my righteous right hand."
promises of God.explanation: This verse reassures us that God is always with us and that He will give us the strength and help we need to overcome our fears and challenges.

promises of God.verse: "The Lord is my light and my salvation—whom shall I fear? The Lord is the stronghold of my life—of whom shall I be afraid?"
promises of God.explanation: This verse reminds us that when we have God as our protector and salvation, we have nothing to fear. He is the stronghold of our lives, and we can trust in Him completely.

promises of God.verse: "Even though I walk through the darkest valley, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me."
promises of God.explanation: This verse assures us that God is with us even in our darkest moments, and His presence brings comfort and peace that overcomes our fears.

promises of God.verse: "When I am afraid, I put my trust in you. In God, whose word I praise—in God I trust and am not afraid. What can mere mortals do to me?"
promises of God.explanation: This verse reminds us that when we put our trust in God, we have nothing to fear. Even in the face of human threats and opposition, we can trust in God's protection and deliverance.

promises of God.verse: "Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go."
promises of God.explanation: This verse is a command to be strong and courageous and not to fear, knowing that God is always with us and will guide us wherever we go.

promises of God.verse: "For God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power and of love and of a sound mind."
promises of God.explanation: This verse reminds us that fear does not come from God. Instead, He gives us power, love, and a sound mind that enables us to overcome our fears and live in faith and confidence.

promises of God.verse: "The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom; all who follow His precepts have good understanding. To him belongs eternal praise."
promises of God.explanation: This verse reminds us that the fear of the Lord, which is reverence and respect for God, is the foundation of true wisdom. When we follow His commands, we gain a deeper understanding of His ways and can experience His blessings and favor in our lives.

fear.verse: "Peace I leave with you; my peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid."
fear.explanation: This verse is a comforting reminder that Jesus has given us His peace, which is not like the peace that the world offers. We can trust in Him and His promises, and we do not have to be afraid or troubled in our hearts.

fear.verse: "When anxiety was great within me, your consolation brought me joy."
fear.explanation: This verse reminds us that when we are feeling anxious, we can turn to God for comfort and joy. His presence and love can soothe our fears and give us a sense of peace.

fear.verse: "I sought the Lord, and he answered me; he delivered me from all my fears."
fear.explanation: This verse is a testimony of how God can deliver us from all our fears when we seek Him. He is faithful to answer us and provide for our needs, including the need for courage and strength.

fear.verse: "When I am afraid, I will trust in you. In God, whose word I praise, in God I trust; I will not be afraid. What can mortal man do to me?"
fear.explanation: This verse encourages us to put our trust in God when we are feeling afraid. His word is worthy of our praise, and He is more powerful than anything that mortal man can do to us.

fear.verse: "Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God. And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus."
fear.explanation: This verse teaches us to bring our anxieties to God in prayer, with thanksgiving, and trust Him to provide for us. When we do this, we can experience the peace of God, which goes beyond our understanding and guards our hearts and minds in Christ Jesus.

fear.verse: "The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusts in him, and he helps me. My heart leaps for joy, and with my song I praise him."
fear.explanation: This verse reminds us that God is our source of strength and protection. When we trust in Him, He helps us and fills us with joy, which we can express through praise and worship.

fear.verse: "Fear of man will prove to be a snare, but whoever trusts in the Lord is kept safe."
fear.explanation: This verse warns us about the danger of fearing people more than God. When we trust in the Lord, we can be kept safe from harm and danger, but when we fear people, it can lead us into traps and snares.

fear.verse: "The Lord is with me; I will not be afraid. What can mere mortals do to me? The Lord is with me; he is my helper. I look in triumph on my enemies."
fear.explanation: Psalm 118:6 reminds us that when we have the Lord with us, we don't have to fear what mere mortals can do to us. We can trust in His protection and deliverance.

depression.verse: "For I know the plans I have for you," declares the Lord, "plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future."
depression.explanation: This verse assures us that God has good plans for our lives and that He intends to bless us and give us hope for the future.

depression.verse: "The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit." - Psalm 34:18
depression.explanation: This verse reminds us that even when we feel brokenhearted and crushed in spirit, God is close to us and will save us.

depression.verse: "Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you." - 1 Peter 5:7
depression.explanation: This verse encourages us to give all our anxieties to God because He cares for us and wants to take care of us.

anxiety.verse: "Peace I leave with you; my peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid." - John 14:27
anxiety.explanation: This verse reminds us that Jesus gives us peace that is different from the peace that the world offers. We don't need to be troubled or afraid because of this peace.

anxiety.verse: "Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God. And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus." - Philippians 4:6-7
anxiety.explanation: This verse instructs us to give our anxieties to God through prayer and thanksgiving. God's peace will guard our hearts and minds when we do this.

anxiety.verse: "When I am afraid, I put my trust in you." - Psalm 56:3
anxiety.explanation: This verse teaches us to put our trust in God when we are afraid. God is our refuge and strength.

dilemma.verse: "Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight." - Proverbs 3:5-6
dilemma.explanation: This verse reminds us to trust in God and submit to His ways instead of relying on our own understanding. When we do this, God will make our paths straight.

dilemma.verse: "The Lord is a refuge for the oppressed, a stronghold in times of trouble." - Psalm 9:9
dilemma.explanation: This verse assures us that God is a refuge and stronghold for us when we are oppressed and troubled. We can find safety and security in Him.

dilemma.verse: "But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well." - Matthew 6:33
dilemma.explanation: This verse encourages us to prioritize seeking God's kingdom and righteousness above all else. When we do this, God will provide for our needs.
